roleset.name: provide
roleset.note: SUPPLY-V NOTES: Frames file for 'supply' based on sentences in financial subcorpus andautomatic expansion via verbnet. (from supply.01-v predicate notes)
SUPPLY-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on supply-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls fulfilling-13.4.1. (from supply.01-n)

example.name: transitive, thing as NP
example.text: For all that, the piece landed unperformed in a dusty archive after [Bologna]-1 refused *trace*-1 to supply a chorus and orchestra.

example.name: transitive, benefactive as NP
example.text: It is widely known within industry circles that [Hess]-3 had *trace-3*-2 to buy oil products in the high-priced spot markets *trace-2*-1 to continue *trace*-1 supplying its customers.

example.name: all args, benefactive as PP
example.text: The company, which *trace* supplies transmissions and other drive-train parts to auto makers, ...

example.name: all args, benefactive as NP
example.text: John supplied Mary with a bouquet of wilted dandelions.
example.arg: with a bouquet of wilted dandelions

example.name: all args
example.text: The U.N. has criticized that nation for its supply of arms to terrorist organizations.

example.name: just arg1
example.text: Economists study the supply of *ICH*-1, and demand for, [goods and services in a society]-1.
